intro: Streblochaete, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. They typically grow in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Streblochaete species are native to regions in Asia, particularly China and Japan. Their leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while their stems are often hairy.
